name: SOCY 290
title: Advanced Topics in Sociological Analysis
description: The topics to be analyzed each year vary with the instructor but focus upon a specific research area. Enrollment restricted to graduate students by consent of the instructor. May be repeated for credit.
class_notes: Topic: Autoethnography. This experiential course focuses on the history and practice of autoethnography. As a methodology, autoethnography situates the personal experiences of a researcher in structural and collective terms. We devote particular attention to legacies of autoethnography in critical sociology, critical geography, and interdisciplinary Black feminist thought, among other traditions. With a focus on reading and crafting autoethnography, this seminar considers its possibilities and critiques. By engaging with emerging forms of autoethnography - including arts-based and somatic approaches - we will address still broader questions about ways of knowing or epistemologies, the philosophy of (Western) science, and the politics of research.
